definition: evening college (abbr. for 夜大學|夜大学[ye4 da4 xue2])
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: I graduated from an evening college just a couple of months ago.
sentences.chinese: 几个月前我刚从夜大毕业生。

sentences.english: Zijun in community college classes, meet ungho again.
sentences.chinese: 子君在夜大上课，又遇到成浩。

sentences.english: About eleven, Well get "Mild-Seven"draw, Please dont go away Rug draw Great draw. Big draw.
sentences.chinese: 大约十一点，我们会有七星之夜大抽奖，请不要走开。

definition: to take a relevant exam for a certificate (e.g. driving test, licence etc)
(of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
student who repeats (a course, grade etc) at school
examination for lower levels of Taiwan government service (short for 普通考試|普通考试[pu3 tong1 kao3 shi4])
